page.title: 02Hollybush Farm.
page.content: {Hollybush Farm}was the first farm we visited.It was rather different because it had a brand new chapel.It is used by a lot of people as a church,a meeting place and it had a small private shop squeezed into the corner of it.In the summer at big open air services people get baptised in the River Wiske which runs through the farm land. The farmer is a religious man.There is a caravan site behind the chapel. The next farm we visited was{Home Farm at Newby Wiske.There were about five hundred sheep being dipped.The smell was disgusting.They had twenty horses for riding.Down a cart track were barley and wheat fields.Poppies were growing wild at the edges of the fields,and the fields were divided by hawthorn hedges.
